intro: Pleurophora uncinata, commonly known as the hooked pleurophora, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, typically growing in moist, calcareous soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are usually pinnately divided, with a distinctive, hairy texture. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
